TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed MessageBoxButtons extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies constants defining which buttons to display on a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration is used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox> class.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox> to give the user an opportunity to prevent a form from closing. This example requires that the method is called from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Form.FormClosing> event of the form.
[!code-cs[Classic MessageBox Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.m_12_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[Classic MessageBox Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.windows.forms.m_12_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[Classic MessageBox Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.m_12_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons AbortRetryIgnore = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The message box contains Abort, Retry, and Ignore buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons OK = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The message box contains an OK button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons OKCancel = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The message box contains OK and Cancel buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons RetryCancel = int32(5)

Docs.summary: The message box contains Retry and Cancel buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons YesNo = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The message box contains Yes and No buttons.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.MessageBoxButtons YesNoCancel = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The message box contains Yes, No, and Cancel buttons.
